Instructions

Submitted papers must be neither previously published nor under review by another workshop, conference or journal.

Only electronic submissions in PDF format will be accepted. Submitted articles must be written in English, conforming to the page limit, in 10-point font and must render without error using standard PDF viewing tools.

Page Limit

Paper 20 pages
Demonstration 2 pages

Papers should use the submission template and instructions for ISCLS, available at ISCLS Submission Template . The template is also available at Overleaf

Source Files
  • Sample TeX Source File: iscls.tex
  • Sample PDF file: iscls.pdf
  • Style file: scl.sty
  • Bibliography Style: acl.bst
  • Sample Bibliography file: iscls.bib

Compilation
Let the fileame of your submision be ABC.tex. 
$ xelatex ABC
$ bibtex ABC
$ bibtex ABC # Remember to run bibtex twice
$ xelatex ABC

Submission
To submit your paper, please follow below link to the submission site:

CMT3 Submission Portal

Note that at least one of the authors of each paper accepted for presentation in 7th ISCLS 2024 must be registered. All papers presented at the workshop will be included in the Association for Computational Linguistics Anthology.

Camera-Ready Instructions

You will receive the information via your email for camera-ready instructions.

Contact

If you have any problems or questions, please contact us via e-mail at: iscls@outlook.com
